metadata.key_specifications: Low-current voltage regulator diodes in SOD523 package, power dissipation ≤ 300 mW, voltage range 1.8 V to 51 V, ± 2% and ± 5% tolerance series, low test current (50 μA) for low bias and portable battery applications

page_summaries.content:
1.  General description
Low-current voltage regulator diodes in an SOD523 (SC-79) ultra small and flat lead Surface-Mounted Device (SMD) plastic package.

2.  Features and benefits
• Total power dissipation: ≤ 300 mW
• Two tolerance series: ± 2 % and approximately ± 5 %
• Working voltage range: nominal 1.8 V to 51 V
• Specified at a low test current (50 μA), ideal for low bias and portable battery-powered applications
• BZX58550-B11 to -C51: Intentional minor rise of leakage current for optimized fast switching and noise reduction [AN90031]

3.  Applications
• Low-current general regulation functions

4.  Quick reference data

Product Summary.content: Low-current voltage regulator diodes in an SOD523 (SC-79) ultra small and flat lead Surface-Mounted Device (SMD) plastic package. Total power dissipation: ≤ 300 mW, two tolerance series: ± 2 % and approximately ± 5 %, working voltage range: nominal 1.8 V to 51 V, specified at a low test current (50 μA), ideal for low bias and portable battery-powered applications. Used for low-current general regulation functions.

Features and benefits include total power dissipation up to 300 mW, two tolerance series (± 2 % and approximately ± 5 %), working voltage range from 1.8 V to 51 V, specified at low test current of 50 μA for low bias and portable battery-powered applications, intentional minor rise of leakage current for optimized fast switching and noise reduction [AN90031].

Quick reference data: forward voltage (VF) at 10 mA is typically 0.9 V max, total power dissipation (Ptot) at ambient temperature ≤ 25 °C is 300 mW max. Comes in an SOD523 (SC-79) ultra small and flat lead SMD plastic package. Used for low-current general regulation functions in portable battery-powered applications.

Electrical Characteristics.content: 8. Limiting values (Table 5) provide the maximum allowable values for parameters such as voltage, current, and power dissipation to ensure safe operation of the device. 9. Thermal characteristics (Table 6) describe the thermal behavior of the device, including parameters like thermal resistance and maximum operating temperature.

10. Electrical characteristics (Tables 7-9) provide detailed specifications for various electrical parameters under different operating conditions. These include forward voltage, reverse current, differential resistance, temperature coefficient, and diode capacitance across different voltage ranges and current levels. The tables are divided based on the specific device type (BZX58550-xxx).

Figures 3-8 graphically illustrate the typical behavior of forward current vs. forward voltage and reverse current vs. reverse voltage for different device types within the BZX58550 series. These curves provide a visual representation of the electrical characteristics described in the tables.
Figure 9 shows the package outline for the SOD523 (SC-79) package, providing dimensional information for physical implementation and integration of the device.

Packaging Information.content: Fig. 7. Reverse current as a function of reverse voltage; typical values (BZX58550-B/C11 to BZX58550-B/C36). Fig. 8. Reverse current as a function of reverse voltage; typical values (BZX58550-B/C39 to BZX58550-B/C51). These figures provide information about the reverse current characteristics of the device for different voltage ranges, which is important for understanding the device's behavior and selecting the appropriate model.
Fig. 9. Package outline SOD523 (SC-79). This figure shows the physical dimensions and outline of the SOD523 (SC-79) package, which is crucial information for PCB design and layout.

Fig. 10. Reflow soldering footprint for SOD523 (SC-79). This figure provides the recommended footprint and land pattern for reflow soldering the SOD523 (SC-79) package, which is essential for proper assembly and manufacturing.
